content: isar scarf by julia vaconsin this is a very simple mid-season scarf that is perfect to show off a beautiful hand dyed yarn set aside the fringe first so you can use up every bit of that beautiful skein finished size 14 cm 5 ½ inches wide and 175 cm 69 inches long measured without the fringe for a narrower or wider scarf add or subtract stitches in multiples of 8 yarn 1 skein of hand maiden sea silk 70% silk 30% seacell 400 m 437 yards /100g 3 53 ounces color blackberry or fingering weight yarn of your choice hook 4 mm g/6 or size needed to obtain the correct gauge gauge 3 ½ pattern repeats and 8 row = 10 cm 4 inches exact gauge is not crucial for this pattern skill level beginner © 2008 julia vaconsin juliavaconsin@gmail com 1 notes this pattern uses us terminology all stitches apart from the last stitch of every row are worked in the chain-1 or chain-2 spaces the last stitch of each row is worked in the top chain of the turning chain of the previous row abbreviations st stitch chain chain double_crochet double_crochet skip skip space space ws wrong side preparation omit this stage if fringe is not desired cut 130 pieces of yarn in 30 cm 12 inch lengths for fringe and set aside instructions leaving at least a 15 cm 6 inch tail chain 40 row 1 double_crochet 2 in 4th chain from hook *skip 3 double_crochet 1 chain 2 double_crochet 1 in next st skip 3 double_crochet 2 chain 1 double_crochet 2 in next st repeat from * across ending row with skip 3 double_crochet 1 chain 1 double_crochet 1 in last chain turn row 2 chain 3 double_crochet 2 in first chain-1-space * double_crochet 1 chain 2 double_crochet 1 in next chain-1-space double_crochet 2 chain 1 double_crochet 2 in next chain-2- space repeat from * across ending row with double_crochet 1 in space between 2 double_crochet and turning chain chain 1 double_crochet 1 in top chain of turning chain turn repeat row 2 for pattern until scarf measures approx 175 cm 69 inches or until you run out of yarn fasten_off leaving a tail of at least 15 cm 6 inches © 2008 julia vaconsin juliavaconsin@gmail com 2 finishing if omitting fringe weave in ends otherwise count ends as strands to be incorporated into the fringe wash and block as desired using the cut strands of yarn * hold 5 strands together fold them in half with ws of the scarf facing you insert hook in bottom edge pull loop through pull all 10 strands through loop on hook and tighten repeat from * 12 more times evenly across bottom edge repeat for top edge copyright 2008 by julia vaconsin this pattern is
